item.dc:creator: @termz termz
item.description:
@termz wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:3, topic:538516”]Vulnerable code is bad, props for being one of the guys who go for MySQLi but the whole point of using the improved version is more or less for the prepared statements feature. This secures the code from SQL injection which ultimately lets any user manipulate your database. When you get round to making the administration panel that allows you to view and handle the reports be sure to secure the code from XSS attacks as well, I’d go more in depth but that could take up a whole post. You’d be wise to look into it.

You should be doing something more along the lines of:
[php]
$stmt = $objCon->prepare(“INSERT INTO report_player (type, category, player, report, proofs, logged_ip) VALUES (?,?,?,?,?,?)”);
//prepares the statement for database execution

$stmt->bind_param("iissss", $type, $category, $player, $report, $proofs, $logged_ip);
	//binds the parameters of the statement, first two being integers and the final four being strings.

$stmt->execute();
	//executes the query, safely and secured.

[/php][/quote]
excellent. glad you posted this.
